pr_title: Add support for PK lookup if additional filters are combined by AND

timeline.message:
Add support for PK lookup if additional filters are combined by AND

If filters are combined by AND operators in addition to filters
on primary key columns, the optimized PK lookup plan is used now.

Closes #10298.

Add support for PK lookup if additional filters are combined by AND

If filters are combined by AND operators in addition to filters
on primary key columns, the optimized PK lookup plan is used now.

Closes #10298.

timeline.body: This isn't streamed and looking at the usages I think being able to change the granularity is currently also not really necessary?
timeline.bodyText: This isn't streamed and looking at the usages I think being able to change the granularity is currently also not really necessary?
timeline.bodyHTML: This isn't streamed and looking at the usages I think being able to change the granularity is currently also not really necessary?
timeline.author: mfussenegger

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
List<Symbol> boundOutputs = Lists2.map(
outputs, s -> SubQueryAndParamBinder.convert(s, params, subQueryResults));
var boundQuery = SubQueryAndParamBinder.convert(query, params, subQueryResults);
var binder = new SubQueryAndParamBinder(params, subQueryResults);
List<Symbol> boundOutputs = Lists2.map(outputs, binder)
var boundQuery = binder.convert(query);

Avoids creating 2 SubQueryAndParamBinder instances
timeline.author: mfussenegger

timeline.body: In which case can `ref.ident().tableIdent().equals(tableRelation.relationName())` be false here?
timeline.bodyText: In which case can ref.ident().tableIdent().equals(tableRelation.relationName()) be false here?
timeline.bodyHTML: In which case can ref.ident().tableIdent().equals(tableRelation.relationName()) be false here?
timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: Should, not happen, I'll remove this.
replies.author: seut

timeline.body:
I also don't quite understand why this check is necessary. `toCollect` is a set, so duplicates won't be added anyways?

Is this under the assumption that the symbol might not be needed because it is only used in the docKeys part? I'm not sure if that assertion is safe. Couldn't the query still use columns from `docKeyColumns` ?
timeline.bodyText:
I also don't quite understand why this check is necessary. toCollect is a set, so duplicates won't be added anyways?
Is this under the assumption that the symbol might not be needed because it is only used in the docKeys part? I'm not sure if that assertion is safe. Couldn't the query still use columns from docKeyColumns ?
timeline.bodyHTML:
I also don't quite understand why this check is necessary. toCollect is a set, so duplicates won't be added anyways?

Is this under the assumption that the symbol might not be needed because it is only used in the docKeys part? I'm not sure if that assertion is safe. Couldn't the query still use columns from docKeyColumns ?
timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText:
Maybe it would make sense to use something like SymbolVisitors.intersection(query, allPossibleTableOutputs, toCollect::add); ?
I think that would handle functions better. If you have a SELECT substr(x, ...) WHERE .. (pk = 1 AND substr(x, ..) it wouldn't add x to the outputs I think.
replies.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: Yep right, good catch. This logic which is intended to only add a filter projection when needed (other columns than DocKeys are part of the query) was not correct. I'll push a new safe logic.
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText: Pushed a fixup before I saw your recent suggestion with the intersection. If you still think I should go in this direction instead, please shout.
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText: And related to WHERE .. (pk = 1 AND substr(x, ..), as the RevVisitor traverses the tree x will be added to the outputs. This query works as expected. Do I miss anything?
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText:
I thought something along the lines of
create table tbl (id int primary key, x int);
select x from tbl where id = 1 and (_seq_no = 1 or x = 1)

But that is forbidden.
Or
select x from tbl where id = 1 and (id = 3 or x = 1);

but that works. So all good 👍
replies.author: mfussenegger

timeline.body: Would it be possible to use the existing `SymbolVisitors.any` or `Symbols.containsColumn`  for this?
timeline.bodyText: Would it be possible to use the existing SymbolVisitors.any or Symbols.containsColumn  for this?
timeline.bodyHTML: Would it be possible to use the existing SymbolVisitors.any or Symbols.containsColumn for this?
timeline.author: mfussenegger

timeline.bodyText: Isn't this already tested in testUpdateUsingSeqNoRequiresPk (UpdatePlannerTest) ?
timeline.author: mfussenegger

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
execute("select id from t1 where id = 1 and x = 2");
assertThat(response.rowCount(), is(0L));
execute("select id from t1 where id = 1 and x = 2");
assertThat(response.rowCount(), is(0L));
execute("select id from t1 where id = 1 and x = 1");
assertThat(response.rowCount(), is(1L));

To have the "pk lookup matches and query matches" part covered too.
timeline.author: mfussenegger
mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: On the methods I know of/found, the given message is used as a prefix for a failure output instead of matching the thrown exception message. Or do other assertThrows implementation exists which I'm not aware of?
replies.author: seut
